title: Sky-High Deposit Interest Rates
description: In 2023, Argentina offered one of the highest deposit interest rates globally at nearly 95%, reflecting the country's efforts to attract savings amidst economic challenges.

title: Significant Claims on Central Government
description: Argentina experienced a substantial growth in claims on its central government, with an annual increase of 341% as a percentage of broad money in 2023, indicating fiscal pressures.

title: High Export Tax Dependency
description: In 2022, taxes on exports constituted over 16% of Argentina's tax revenue, highlighting the country's reliance on export duties for fiscal income.

title: Negative Financial Flows with IMF
description: Argentina recorded a negative net financial flow with the IMF amounting to over $5 billion in 2023, indicating more repayments than new borrowings.

title: Decline in Private Nonguaranteed Financial Flows
description: In 2023, Argentina saw a negative flow of private nonguaranteed financial resources, totaling approximately $140 million, suggesting challenges in attracting private investment.

title: Productive Agricultural Workforce
description: In 2023, the value added per worker in Argentina's agriculture, forestry, and fishing sectors was $174,268, showcasing the sector's productivity and importance to the economy.
